results.title: Aboriginal women artists
results.creator_credit: Christoph Willing, David Roberts, Peter Lipscombe and University of Sydney Television Service
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Talking about Aboriginal art”.
The images by the four Aboriginal women artists in this video program challenge old steroetypes that have seen the artistic activities of Aboriginal women as limited to crafts and body decoration. They use media techniques with which Western artists are familiar but the imagery is distinctively their own revealing the artist’s Aboriginality, whether she lives in a tradition-oriented community or an urban environment. Banduk Marika produces linocuts and fabric designs often involving stories from her clan group. Fiona Foley works in a variety of contemporary media to produce work about her history and against popular stereotypes of Aboriginal people. Bronwyn Bancroft is known for her fabrics, fashion designs and paintings utilizing images of her family and Koori heritage. Euphemia Bostock has helped bring international attention to Koorie fashion design and art through her teaching and practice.

results.title: A Winter's tale = Conte d'hiver
results.creator_credit: Eric Rohmer, Margaret Menegoz and Les Films du Losange
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Tales of the four seasons = Contes des quatre saisons”.
Felicie’s love for Charles is undiminished four years after a romantic idyll during a summer holiday in Brittany but he has not contacted her - the home address she gave him was incorrect. In the meantime she has given birth to his daughter and is unable to choose between two adoring suitors. Rohmer, with more than a passing reference to Shakespeare, locates his customarily precise observation of the everyday complexities of human psychology in a tale of accident and coincidence. For Felice, the emotional aftermath of a lost summer is suspended or frozen until the thaw of a spring of promise. In French with English subtitles. Cast includes Charlotte Very, Frederic Van Den Driessche and Michel Voletti.

results.title: Talking to Australians
results.brief_description: This video and guide were prepared to aid overseas students’ undestanding of communication in Australia. They allow the student to consider the similarities and differences in social rules that exist between cultures. The video is 18 minutes long and includes 10 scenes illustrating communication difficulties that the student may experience whilst living in Australia. The guide has been designed to follow the scenes in the video, briefly summarising each scene, discussing potential questions, and commenting about the situation and the associated socil rule.

results.title: Targets
results.creator_credit: Peter Bogdanovich, Saticoy and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: The first feature of Peter Bogdanovich combines two seemingly unrelated plots. Plot one follows the depressed retiring horror film actor (Boris Karloff) and his despairing of the real horror of 60’s America. Meanwhile a lone sniper picks off strangers after coldly killing his parents and a delivery boy. The disquieting plots meet after tenion builds at a drive-in cinema. A tense and disturbing film. Cast also include Tim O’Kelly, Nancy Hsueh and James Brown.

results.title: Tara's mulch garden
results.creator_credit: Jon Pedersen, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is a simple, poetic film about mulching. Tara Callaghan explains the principle of her garden, takes us through the different growing phases, and leaves us with a splendid harvest of healthy vegetables.

results.title: A Summer's tale = Conte d'ete
results.creator_credit: Eric Rohmer, Margaret Menegoz, Canal+, Sofilmka, La Sept Cinema and Les Films du Losange
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Tales of the four seasons = Contes des quatre saisons”.
Gaspard (Melvil Poupard), a musically inclined maths graduate with time to kill is waiting for his girlfriend, Lena, in the resort town of Dinard, unbeknownst that his stable and uneventful life is about to be turned on it head when he becomes torn between his affections for three women. He whiles away the lazy afternoon hours with Margot (Amanda Langlet), a part time student and pancake house worker, and most importantly - a good listener. Margot wants a purely platonic relationship with Gaspard as she already has a boyfriend. Enter likely candidate number three, Margot’s friend Solene (Gwenaelle Simon), whom Gaspard becomes instantly smitten with and agrees to spend a weekend with on the island of Ouessant. When Lena finally arrives on the island Gaspard must finally make a choice between three women who are all offering him something different in the relationship stakes. In French with English subtitles. This film, the third in Rohmer’s “4 Season cycle” finds the director in fine story telling form.

results.title: Talking of safety
results.creator_credit: Ron Tanner, David Evans and Millbank Films
results.brief_description: Deals with the effectiveness of safety committee meetings. Shows how a newly-appointed safety supervisor at a brick and tile manufacturing plant in England makes his committee work more effectively while promoting clearly defined objectives.

results.title: Autumn tale = Conte d'Automne
results.creator_credit: Eric Rohmer, Margaret Menegoz, Sofilmka, Rhone-Alpes Cinema, La Sept Cinema and Canal+
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Tales of the four seasons = Contes des quatre saisons”.
The final instalment in Eric Rohmer’s “Tales of the four seasons” quartet of films looks at a later life romance. Friends and family of the widowed Magali decide that it is time she was matched up with a new lover. Beautifully filmed in the vineyards of the Rhone Valley. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Tape
results.creator_credit: Richard Linklater, Alexis Alexanian, Gary Winick, Anne Walker-McBay, Independent Film Channel and InDigEnt (US)
results.brief_description: Set in a dull Michigan motel room, based on a one-act play, comes Richard Linklater’s “Tape” shot digitally and edited using Final Cut software. Two high school friends Vince (Ethan Hawke) and John (Robert Sean-Leonard) re-unite as twenty-something adults to reminisce. Memory and real events are questioned with the arrival of Amy (Uma Thurman) who claims she was date-raped by both of them. Tense and gripping with wonderful performances from the three leads. Based on the stage play by Stephen Belber.
